step1.sentence: You should think twice before quitting your job without another one lined up.

step2.story: Maya was about to send an angry email to her manager, but her colleague stopped her. 'Think twice before you hit send,' he warned quietly. She took a deep breath and rewrote the message with a calmer tone.

step3.story: After months of frustration, Daniel had finally decided to confront his business partner about their failing startup. He drafted a resignation letter late at night, ready to walk away from everything they had built together. But as he reached for his phone to send it, his wife placed a hand on his shoulder. 'Think twice,' she said softly. 'This is five years of your life.' He put the phone down, made himself a cup of coffee, and spent the next hour reviewing the numbers one more time. By morning, he had a new proposal instead of a goodbye.

meaning.literalMeaningKo: 두 번 생각하다, 즉 어떤 행동을 하기 전에 한 번 더 신중하게 고려하다.
meaning.realUsageKo: 충동적으로 행동하려는 상황에서 잠시 멈추고 결과를 다시 생각해보라고 권고할 때 사용합니다. 주로 경고나 조언의 맥락에서 자주 쓰입니다.
meaning.etymologyKo: 글자 그대로 '두 번(twice) 생각하다(think)'는 의미로, 한 번의 판단으로 성급히 행동하지 말고 재고(再考)하라는 영어권의 오랜 표현입니다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 단순히 '다시 생각해봐'라는 권유보다 더 강한 경고의 뉘앙스를 지닙니다. 상대방이 실수하거나 후회할 행동을 하려 할 때 충고하는 어조로 쓰입니다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: I would think twice about investing all your savings in one stock.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 모든 저축을 한 종목에 투자하는 건 다시 한번 신중히 생각해보는 게 좋을 것 같아요.
